folder: Hillside Avenue & Lefferts Boulevard, Queens, NY
text:
Hillside Ave., south side, between Lefferts Boulevard and 118th Street (formerly Church Street), showing a Carnegie Library in Richmond Hill, Jamaica.

About 1910.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: Lefferts Boulevard & Hillside Avenue, Queens, NY
text:
86.21 Lefferts Boulevard, east side, between Hillside and Jamaica Avenues, showing Boolwinkel and Krooss' grocery store. This building first appears on an 1891 map.

P. L. Sperr                          August 22, 1932

folder: Lefferts Boulevard & Hillside Avenue, Queens, NY
text:
86.09 Lefferts Boulevard, adjoining the S.E. corner of Hillside Avenue. This old house was Public School No. 8 of Richmond Hill as shown on 1873 and 1891 atlases. On the right is a one-story building of the Richmond Hill Republican Club.

P. L. Sperr

August 22, 1932

folder: Lefferts Boulevard & Hillside Avenue, Queens, NY
text:
Lefferts Boulevard, at the S.E. corner of Hillside Avenue, showing a rambling house. It first appears on a 1909 map. A sign on the porch reads: Simonson, Undertaker.

P. L. Sperr                          August 22, 1932

folder: Lefferts Boulevard & Hillside Avenue, Queens, NY
text:
86.17-19 Lefferts Boulevard, east side, between Hillside and Jamaica Avenues.

P. L. Sperr                          August 22, 1932
